page.title: 18Schools
page.content: In the town of Rhuddlan, there are two schools.{Ysgol y Castell}is the local primary school which in 1985 had some 220 pupils aged between 4 and 11 years of age on roll.The school also has a newly opened 'nursery unit' although the future of this looks increasingly bleak in view of the current economic climate. Pupils follow a wide ranging course of education through the medium of English and Welsh.The school has an excellent sporting and music/drama tradition, winning honours in both fields.It is also the centre of many communal activities .Money has been raised within the community for the purpose of establishing a new comm- unity centre on another site. {Ysgol TirMorfa}forms part of a school complex providing education for those with special educational needs.
